thread.title: Courtney Barnett sitting pretty with a swag of Age Music Victoria Awards nominations
thread.title_full: Courtney Barnett sitting pretty with a swag of Age Music Victoria Awards nominations

author: Martin Boulton
title: Courtney Barnett sitting pretty with a swag of Age Music Victoria Awards nominations
text:
Courtney Barnett tops the nominations at this year's The Age Music Victoria Awards. 
Vote in The Age Music Victoria Awards 2015 10th anniversary concert line-up 2015 Hall of Fame inductees Later this month Courtney Barnett plays the famous Hollywood Bowl, the scene of famous performances over many years by the Beatles, the Doors, Elton John, Jimi Hendrix, Cher, Alicia Keys and only last month Kanye West.
A couple of days afterwards Barnett will be on stage, again supporting English stars Blur, at Madison Square Garden.
Ella Thompson is nominated for best female. Photo: supplied 
Sandwiched between those shows Barnett and her band play San Francisco's Fillmore theatre before flying back home to Melbourne, where she's a special guest performer in the 10th edition of The Age Music Victoria Awards. Barnett tops this year's nominations with five, including best album for Sometimes I Sit and Think, and Sometimes I Just Sit , plus best female and two best song nominations for Depreston and Pedestrian at Best .
Advertisement Having also picked up several ARIA nominations this week , Barnett's achievements this year keep her at the forefront of Australia's musical exports, capturing huge audiences on US television and thrilling fans around the world with her live show. Soon after her upcoming Melbourne performance at 170 Russell she's touring again, back to the United Kingdom and Europe before a round of summer festival appearances in Australia.
Jess Ribeiro's critically acclaimed album Kill It Yourself earned her a nomination in The Age Music Victoria Awards best female category and best song with Hurry Back to Love . Ribeiro and Barnett are joined in the best song category by Melbourne rock band the Peep Tempel with Carol and Pearls' Big Shot .
The Age Music Victoria Awards 
The Peep Tempel also scored nominations for best band and best live band, while Totally Mild earned three nominations with their album Down Time among this year's outstanding albums. Local favourites Dick Diver, Ben Salter and Dorsal Fins join Totally Mild and Barnett in the best album category.
Ella Thompson, whose own huge year included a recent support show with Mark Ronson at Rod Laver Arena, has been nominated for best female alongside Sui Zhen, Mojo Juju,  Ribeiro and Barnett.
Briggs, Marlon Williams, Tom Iansek (Big Scary, #1 Dads), Fraser A. Gorman and C. W. Stoneking were all nominated for best male.
Jess Ribeiro has picked up nominations for best female and best song. Photo: supplied 
* The Age Music Victoria Awards are the largest publicly voted music awards in the country. Online voting is now open at theage.com.au/agemusicvictoriaawards where the full list of nominees can be seen and voted for by the public until November 6.
Tickets to The Age Music Victoria Awards on November 11 are now on sale at 170russell.com or call 1300 724 867. For more information go to musicvictoria.com.au 
2015 NOMINEES Marlon Williams. Photo: supplied 
BEST ALBUM 
Courtney Barnett – Sometimes I Sit and Think, and Sometimes I Just Sit 
​ Dick Diver – Melbourne, Florida 
​ Dorsal Fins – Mind Renovation 
​ Ben Salter – The Stars My Destination 
​ Totally Mild – Down Time 
BEST SONG 
Courtney Barnett – Depreston 
​ Courtney Barnett – Pedestrian at Best 
​ Pearls – Big Shot 
​ Jess Ribeiro – Hurry Back To Love 
​ The Peep Tempel – Carol
